x-codeSamples.source: curl -u USERNAME:PASSWORD https://api.theracingapi.com/v1/courses
x-codeSamples.label: curl

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

url = "https://api.theracingapi.com/v1/courses"
params = {}
response = requests.request("GET", url, auth=HTTPBasicAuth('USERNAME','PASSWORD'), params=params)
print(response.json())
x-codeSamples.label: Python3

x-codeSamples.source:
<?php
$username = 'USERNAME';
$password = 'PASSWORD';
$url = "https://api.theracingapi.com/v1/courses";

$params = http_build_query([ ]);

$ch = curl_init("$url?$params");
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPAUTH, CURLAUTH_BASIC);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERPWD, "$username:$password");

$response = curl_exec($ch);

if (curl_errno($ch)) {
  echo 'Error:' . curl_error($ch);
} else {
  echo $response;
}

curl_close($ch);
?>

get.description:
Get historic results for all races in the last 12 months

Required PlanStandard
Rate Limit2 requests per second
Add-ons[Optional] Core database historical results add-on: users on the Pro Plan can pay a one-time fee of £299 to remove the 12 month restriction and access over 30 years of results from this endpoint. Contact support@theracingapi.com for information.

Efficiently querying and exporting results data

While the parameters for this endpoint allow for a wide date range to be set (utilising 'start_date' and 'end_date'), the necessary use of 'skip' to access all results for a wide date range query will reduce perfomance the larger that range is.

The most efficient way to query results data over time is to build a list of dates within your date range, then make queries for each date in that list.

A sample python script outlining this method can be viewed here: https://gist.github.com/theracingapi/4d492dbdba58c2072fe4f98ee090126f

tags.name: Introduction
tags.description:
Welcome to The Racing API

The Racing API provides a set of RESTful JSON endpoints, returning horse racing data from our database of over 500,000 results and pre-race racecards. The API is designed to meet the needs of application developers, data scientists, businesses and websites requiring punctual and accurate horse racing data.

This API reference contains the technical documentation users will require to connect their integrations and third-party applications.

FAQ | Data Coverage | Terms of Service

For support or feature requests, please email support@theracingapi.com.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
Once you subscribe to The Racing API, you will receive a set of API keys named 'Username' and 'Password' via email.

In order to authenticate your requests, you should use HTTP Basic Authentication, passing your username and password (Base64 encoded) in the Authorization header of your request.

If your account becomes inactive or you attempt to access endpoints not available to your subscription level, requests will return a 401 Unauthorized response.

tags.name: Rate Limits
tags.description:
Requests are limited to 2 per second for every plan. Exceeding this limit will return a 429 Too Many Requests response.

As of January 2024, analysis endpoint requests may in some instances be limited to one active request at a time, per user. This is due to a significant expansion of the historical results database in November 2023.

tags.name: Endpoint Overview
tags.description:
Core API

The Racing API's Core API provides access to our primary horse racing data set, containing over three decades of horse racing results and updating with the latest data every 5 minutes.

This API provides full pre and post race data coverage of UK and Irish horse racing, as well as global coverage of group level races and selected handicaps. You can view a breakdown of coverage by year and region here

Every user who subscribes to The Racing API gains access to some or all of the Core API endpoints, subject to their specific plan level.

The Core API is divided in to 11 top-level categories:

Endpoint Category Description
/courses/ Course and region data, such as course names, course ids and region codes.
/dams/ Dam data and analysis. Dams can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their progeny's race performances can be queried by dam id.
/damsires/ Damsire data and analysis. Damsires can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their grand offspring's race performances can be queried by damsire id.
/horses/ Horse data and analysis. Horses can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their race performances can be queried by horse id.
/jockeys/ Jockey data and analysis. Jockeys can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their race performances can be queried by jockey id.
/odds/ Detailed odds data for a given runner, including price movements.
/owners/ Owner data and analysis. Owners can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their horse's race performances can be queried by owner id.
/racecards/ Detailed racecard (pre-race) data.
/results/ Detailed results (post-race) data.
/sires/ Sire data and analysis. Sires can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their progeny's race performances can be queried by sire id.
/trainers/ Trainer data and analysis. Trainers can be searched for by name and results/analysis of their horses's race performances can be queried by trainer id.

Analysis Endpoints

The Core API's analysis endpoints perform data aggregation to return helpful betting & probability insights.

The statistics returned by these endpoints include:

  • Win Percentage (win_%): The number of wins divided by total runs/rides for a given query. For example, a win_% figure of 0.18 represents an 18% win percentage.
  • 1 Unit Profit/Loss (1_pl): Profit/loss for total rides/runs for a given query, if a 1 unit stake was placed at SP.
  • Actual/Expected (a/e): Actual number of wins, divided by expected number of wins for a given query. Expected number of wins is calculated from SP. For a detailed explanation of this statistic, see here.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Anaysis endpoints only perform data aggregation on results for which SP odds are available.

Regional API's

The Regional APIs provide access to additional data sets that provide complete coverage for a given region. The data and fields returned are also much more specific to that region than they may be in the Core API.

Accessing the endpoints for these data sets requires purchasing the relevant regional data add-on for your plan, which can be requested by emailing support@theracingapi.com.

The following top-level regional endpoints are available:
Region Description
/australia/ Meets and races for Australia
/north-america/ Meets, entries and results for the USA and Canada
